articles.author: SAM MAGDY Associated Press
articles.title: Fleeing war, poverty, African migrants face racism in Egypt
articles.description: Hundreds of thousands of sub-Saharan African migrants call Cairo their temporary home
articles.content:
CAIRO -- 
Two Sudanese sisters, Seham and Ekhlas Bashir, were walking their children home from elementary school in a Cairo neighborhood when a group of Egyptian teenagers crowded around them. They boys taunted them, calling them slave and other slurs. Then … [+5815 chars]

articles.author: The Associated Press
articles.title: Several feared trapped in factory fire in Indian capital
articles.description: A fire official says a factory caught fire and collapsed in the Indian capital and several people are feared trapped
articles.content:
NEW DELHI -- 
A factory caught fire and collapsed in the Indian capital Thursday and several people were feared trapped, a fire official said.
Rescue work was in progress in Peera Garhi area in western New Delhi.
The New Delhi Television news channel said … [+374 chars]

articles.author: The Associated Press
articles.title: Report: Taiwan's top military official survives copter crash
articles.description: Taiwan's top military official is reported to be among at least 11 survivors of a Blackhawk helicopter crash
articles.content:
TAIPEI, Taiwan -- 
Taiwan's top military official was reported among at least 11 survivors of a Blackhawk helicopter crash Thursday morning in mountains outside the capital.
Two people were missing in the crash that occurred as the helicopter was flying fro… [+412 chars]

articles.author: YURI KAGEYAMA Associated Press
articles.title: Japan's emperor waves to crowds in 1st New Year's greeting
articles.description: Japan's Emperor Naruhito has waved to cheering, flag-waving crowds from a palace balcony in his first New Year's greeting since ascending to the throne
articles.content:
TOKYO -- 
Japan's Emperor Naruhito waved to cheering, flag-waving crowds from a palace balcony Thursday in his first New Year's greeting since ascending to the throne.

articles.title: Asian markets mostly higher on optimism about US-China deal
articles.description: Asian shares are mostly higher on optimism about a U.S.-China trade deal as regional markets open for the new year's first day of trading
articles.content:
TOKYO -- 
Asian shares were mostly higher on optimism about a U.S.-China trade deal as regional markets opened the new year's first day of trading Thursday.

articles.author: The Associated Press
articles.title: Larsen, who threw only perfect World Series game, dies at 90
articles.description: Don Larsen was a journeyman who reached the heights of baseball glory in 1956.
articles.content:
NEW YORK -- 
Don Larsen, the journeyman pitcher who reached the heights of baseball glory in 1956 for the New York Yankees when he threw a perfect game and the only no-hitter in World Series history, died Wednesday night. He was 90.
Larsen's agent, Andrew L… [+5110 chars]

articles.title: Some flee, others restock before Australia's wildfires grow
articles.description: Thousands of tourists are fleeing Australia's wildfire-ravaged eastern coast ahead of worsening conditions as the military started to evacuate people trapped on the shore further south
articles.content:
PERTH, Australia -- 
Thousands of tourists fled Australia's wildfire-ravaged eastern coast Thursday ahead of worsening conditions as the military started to evacuate people trapped on the shore further south.
